result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Adrian K Dejesus

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Adrian K Dejesus appeared by phone.  Attorney John Mathew Krejci in court for Adrian K Dejesus.  Attorney Matthew Zisi in court for State of Wisconsin.   Case in court to adjourn the 10/31/2023 due to unavailability of judicial official on the jury trial date.  Court ordered case adjourned for jury trial in Reserve Branch 13.
Jury trial scheduled for December 14, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Adrian K Dejesus in court.  Attorney John Mathew Krejci in court for Adrian K Dejesus.  Prosecuting attorney Nate Kristian McClure in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for final pretrial.  Case remains in trial posture.  Case adjourned to Branch 13.  Jury trial remains scheduled for October 31, 2022 at 09:00 am.
State's Witness List, filed.
State's Proposed Jury Instructions, filed.
State's Motion in Limine, filed.

Defendant Adrian K Dejesus in court with attorney John Mathew Krejci.  Thomas Hasle appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for plea and sentencing hearing. Defense requested a projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 13.  Final pre-trial scheduled for September 23, 2022 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for October 31, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Notice of bond forfeiture mailed to defendant. ($1,000.00 signature bond) LW

Defendant Adrian K Dejesus in court with attorney John Mathew Krejci.  Nate Kristian McClure appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense requests a plea/sentencing hearing. Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 37.
All parties are advised effective August 1, 2022 this case will be assigned to a Branch of RESERVE JUDGES.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 12, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
Court ordered bench warrant withdrawn.  Recall issued.

Defendant Adrian K Dejesus in court.  Katrina Amy Voge appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference in Br. 37.  Scheduling conference scheduled for July 1, 2022 at 08:30 am.
signed and filed.
Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued REMAND TO COMMISSIONER.   Court further orders that bail is forfeited.
Attorney John Mathew Krejci in court.  Nate Kristian McClure appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued.
received and filed.

Defendant Adrian K Dejesus in court with attorney Matt W Kline.  Thomas Hasle appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: MK.  Case in court for Calendar Call. Defendant appears. Court vacates the stayed warrant. Defense requests for a status of counsel. Case adjourned for status of counsel, Branch 37.  Status conference scheduled for June 23, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Matt W Kline in court.  Thomas Hasle appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney appeared by video means.   Deputy court clerk:  vk  Hearing held via zoom/DAcast.   Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a bench warrant issued but stayed the issuance until the next court date.  Calendar call scheduled for May 6, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Adrian K Dejesus in court with attorney Matt W Kline.  Michael R Staskunas appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Adrian K Dejesus appeared by video means with Attorney.  Deputy court clerk:  vk  Hearing held via zoom/DAcast.  Defense counsel has received discovery and offer and requests additional time to review.   Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 37.   This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/3c595ccd-39e3-09d4-8db1-82162d766d4f  Status conference scheduled for April 15, 2022 at 09:00 am.
received and filed

No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
DEFENDANT WAS ORDERED BY THE COURT TO REPORT TO THE MILWAUKEE COUNTY JAIL (CJF) TO BE BOOKED AND RELEASED BY 5:00 P.M. ON 02/25/2022. IF THEY FAIL TO APPEAR A BENCH WARRANT WILL BE ISSUED FOR THEIR ARREST.

Defendant Adrian K Dejesus in court.  Jennifer L Pickett appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant advised that this case is assigned to Judge Dee, Branch 37.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Defendant IS Public Defender eligible. Defendant is ordered to provide the public defender's office with the next court date.  
The case is adjourned to Br. 37 for a Pretrial Conference.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for March 16, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 2/23/22 @ 1:30p
